entry.title: Re: external definition imported from sap pi is causing i...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information solves your issue? (GenAI was used to help generate this content)

When migrating SAP PI interfaces to SAP CPI, issues such as missing nodes in message mappings can occur, often due to prefix mismatches in external definitions. Here are some steps you can take to address these issues:

  1. Review External Definitions: Ensure that the external definitions used in SAP PI are correctly imported into SAP CPI. Check if the prefixes used in the XML schema definitions are consistent.

  2. Adjust Prefixes: If prefixes are causing nodes to be missing, you may need to manually adjust the prefixes in the external definitions within SAP CPI to match those used in SAP PI.

  3. Use Developer Extensibility: Developer Extensibility of Incoming Format Mappings SAP S/4HANA Cloud offers developer extensibility options that can be used to preprocess or postprocess input and output files. This can help in adjusting structures as needed.

Developer Extensibility of Incoming Format Mappings

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: What value pick for the tag <PmtInfId> in DME XML fil...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information solves your issue? (GenAI was used to help generate this content)

In the SAP pre-delivered payment file for Switzerland, the <PmtInfId> tag in the DME payment file (XML) is derived from the reference number used in the payment process. It appears that the system adds a specific value, such as 101, to the reference number to generate the <PmtInfId>.

For example, if the reference number is 1000000250, the <PmtInfId> in the payment file becomes 1000000351. This transformation is likely part of the standard configuration or logic applied by SAP to ensure uniqueness or compliance with specific requirements.

Unfortunately, the exact logic or configuration details for this transformation are not readily visible in the ‘Manage Automatic Payments’ app. It might be necessary to check the configuration settings or consult SAP documentation specific to Switzerland’s payment formats for further insights.

If you need to adjust or understand this behavior further, you might consider exploring the configuration settings related to payment formats.

Switzerland: Configuring Payment Medium Formats

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Influencing posting price at GR with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CR...
entry.content:
The field AMOUNT_LC in GOODSMVT_ITEM does update MSEG-EXBWR, which is the externally entered amount. However, MSEG-DMBTR (the actual valuation amount) is not influenced by AMOUNT_LC unless specific conditions are met. So yes, you can enter a manual amount, but it won’t override the valuation price unless SAP is explicitly configured to accept it; which it typically is not in standard scenarios.

Why MSEG-DMBTR is not updated is because, SAP uses standard valuation logic based on:
- Material master price (standard or moving average)
- Purchase order price
- Valuation class and account determination
Even if you pass a custom amount via AMOUNT_LC, the system still calculates DMBTR using its internal valuation rules unless
- You use a non-valuated movement type
- You post to a non-valuated stock
- You implement a custom enhancement or BAdI

Possible Workarounds are
1. Custom Movement Type
- Create a Z-movement type that allows manual valuation
- Set valuation indicator to allow external price input
2. Enhancement via BAdI
- Use MB_DOCUMENT_BADI or MB_MIGO_BADI to override valuation logic
- Inject custom logic to set DMBTR based on EXBWR
3. Use Non-Valuated GR
- If business allows, post GR as non-valuated and handle valuation separately

entry.title: SAP Concur Fusion Exchange EMEA in London.
entry.content:
On June 12th I attended Fusion Exchange EMEA in London.

I was hosting a booth with a colleague to represent our area of expertise which is SAP Integration with Concur Solutions also knows as ICS.  More about that further down.

Fusion Exchange EMEA is a one-day, complimentary event to exchange knowledge with your peers managing travel, expense and invoice, our partners, and SAP Concur experts. It is an event to showcase the latest industry trends, value-adding solutions for business organisations, and how to maximise your SAP Concur investment.

The agenda offered immersive educational sessions, ample opportunity to network, and personalised experiences.

 

SAP Concur Keynote

Since, I was manning the ICS booth I did not get so much time to explore the various sessions, but I was able to attend the SAP Concur keynote.  They keynote kicked off at 09:15 for an hour.  It was inspiring to see the SAP Concur leaders as they unveiled the next era of travel and expense management.

They shared the vision shaping our industries future and spoke about the latest innovations. I also heard inspiring insights and real-world stories from customers. In my daily work I never get to see and hear how it truly is “on the other side” face to face.  I must admit I was very impressed.  It is also nice to see and hear what is happening within the company outside of my area of expertise. It made me realise how big the Travel and Expense industry is and how many companies rely on us in SAP Concur for their companies to run their T&E departments efficiently day to day.

Throughout the day there were also 11 Breakout sessions, and 6 Micro Forums open to all.  As I wrote above I did not have much time to attend many sessions but I did manage to slip away twice.   

Expense Breakout Session - A closer look at managing expenses: recent innovations and peer use cases

Here I saw Control spend before it happens, with Concur Request, ExpenseIT on the Web, Microsoft Teams Integration, Microsoft Outlook Integration - Attendee adding, receipt digitalization and much more.  For me and I’m sure many others it was the AI part I really wanted to hear about.  I was delighted when a slide popped up with the header titled AI at every step of the process.   This part focused on creating an intelligent front-loaded user experience, where you can optimise compliance and user experience at every step with no compromise.  The industry future is changing faster than I thought.

 

Breakout Session - Revolutionising compliance through innovation and technology

I have been in the financial software industry for almost 30 years both as a developer and consultant. Compliance has always been a topic that interests me and a topic i feel only in the last 5 – 6 years is only getting the attention it deserves.  I can remember many occasions when i was a payroll developer writing ABAP reports to fix customer own EOY reconciliations which were most regulatory and not policy for tax and auditing. That feels like a lifetime ago now.

My take aways were where the current approaches fall short because of decentralized controls, lack of real time monitoring and gaps in trainings etc.

AI will also play a big a role to help improve spend compliance (Behaviour) and efficiency (usability).   AI for example can help with instant trip estimation, simple receipt capture and expense creation with automatic hotel automatization.

An interesting slide I saw had the following statistic.  For Hotel Itemization there can be up to 93% reduction in time spent on approvals for rejected expense reports.  That made me smile.

 

SAP Integration with Concur Solutions Booth

My colleague Ryma and I manned the booth for the day. We had over 35 visitors.  I always enjoy meeting customers and this was no exception.   Throughout the day we answered many prospective and existing customer questions on a broad range of topics ranging from setup to posting and how to fulfill business requirements.    

A further plus was meeting colleagues such as Angela, Paul and Rahul who I only ever really see on a screen.   It was a pleasure to meet you and have some laughs.

Lastly a special thank you to Ryma. It was a joy to represent our product and team with you.

If for some reason you are reading this blog and would like to know more about SAP Financial Integration with Concur Solutions then simply send an e-mail to sapconcurintegration@sap.com with the word subscribe in the subject of the e-mail.

Then you will be invited to our Work Zone Workspaces (aka SAP Jam pages).

I will sign off with the following.   It’s no fun running around London trying to find a Labubu doll while running for a flight.  If you know.. you know 😊 !

Bye for now.

Damien Fleming.

entry.title: Re: SD Flexible Workflow
entry.content: Hi, if a workflow is rejected - the workflow stops. The creator is notified of the rejection and the sales lines will show as rejected.

entry.title: Re: SD Flexible Workflow
entry.content: Hi, if a workflow is rejected - the workflow stops. The creator is notified of the rejection and the sales lines will show as rejected. If the document is sent for re-work -presumably the sales document will be changed? If it is changed the workflow starts again from the start. If the document does not need to be changed - it will be waiting in the creators inbox. They can then use the "re-work not required" option and send it back to the approver with their own comments.

entry.title: Re: How do I configure the serial number to require valid...
entry.content:
To meet your requirement, validating serial numbers and triggering errors on mismatch, you’ll need to implement a custom check using a BAdI like Serial_Number_Check. SAP introduced this BAdI, specifically for this purpose. It allows you to:
- Validate serial numbers entered by operators
- Compare against existing serial numbers in the system
- Trigger custom error messages if the serial number is invalid or mismatched
You can implement this using the Custom Logic app in Fiori.

entry.title: Re: Condition Types in Purchase Orders and Contracts (Hea...
entry.content:
Hello @Shubham120798 

Only a predefined set of condition types is available—custom types or pricing routines are not allowed in S4HANA Publi cloud. These are used during pricing in sales documents like sales orders, contracts, and quotations.
  Common Standard Condition Types

Item-Level:

  • PPR0 – Base price
  • MWST – Output tax (statistical)
  • FRA1 – Freight charges
  • VPRS – Cost (statistical)

Header-Level (manual only):

  • HB00 – Absolute discount
  • RB00 – Percentage discount
  • HD00 – Freight charge
  • RO00 – Manual adjustment

You can maintain condition records using the Manage Prices – Sales app.
How to Check in Your System

  • SSCUI 100297 – View allowed condition types (read-only)
  • SSCUI 100505 – View pricing procedure setup
  • CDS View I_SalesOrderItemPricingElement – Analyze applied condition types in orders

Configuring Pricing Using the Implementation Activities App 

Let me know if helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Handling inventory updates from EWM to S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in 7L1 integration scenario
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m working on an integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP EWM on Private Cloud, using the 7L1 scope item and communication scenario SAP_COM_0A58.

The standard delivery-based processes (inbound, outbound, stock transport orders) are working fine. However, we’re facing challenges with warehouse-driven updates that need to be reflected back in ERP.

Examples of limitations we’re encountering:

  • Pick Denial
    When picking in EWM is partially denied, the reduced quantity is not reflected in the outbound delivery in ERP. This can cause inconsistencies in fulfillment and invoicing.

  • Physical Inventory Differences
    When a cycle count is processed and differences are posted in EWM, the updated stock quantity is not synchronized back to ERP. The ERP stock remains unchanged.

  • Ready for Shipping status
    When the goods are packed or staged in EWM, the “Ready for Shipping” status is not updated in the ERP delivery.

According to SAP Note 3629180:

SAP clearly states these processes are not supported in the standard 7L1 integration.

I’ve come across several discussions and documents suggesting that these types of updates could be solved via custom SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) flows for example, by pushing events from EWM and updating ERP via exposed APIs.

My question:

  • Is CPI indeed the recommended workaround for synchronizing EWM status and inventory changes to ERP in this scenario?

  • Are there any best practices, alternative approaches, or roadmap items to cover these types of back-synchronizations?

  • How are other customers or partners solving this in mixed EWM decentralized + S/4HANA Public Cloud environments?

Any guidance or insights would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to use MF60 for creating WM transfer r...
entry.content:
Normally, MF60 is used to transfer components from a replenishment location (e.g., warehouse) to an issue location (e.g., production line). If both are the same, SAP may not generate a transfer requirement because it sees no need to move stock.

How to make it work is to use Movement Type 311. Even if the locations are the same, MF60 can still create a reservation using movement type 311 (stock transfer within the same plant). This helps in tracking staging activity even if no physical movement occurs.
In customizing, ensure that Pull List Control is set up to allow staging even when locations match. You may need to tweak the logic to force a reservation for visibility.
- In MF60, after selecting the production order, go to Replenishment Elements → Replenishment Proposals, manually enter the same location for both issue and replenishment. SAP will still generate a staging document if the system sees a shortfall.
Check the box for “Round up replenishment proposals”. Leave Selection Horizon blank to include all requirements. This ensures the system doesn’t skip staging due to timing filters

By doing so, what you will achieve is
- A reservation document (visible in MB25) showing movement type 311
- Components staged “virtually” for production tracking
- Better visibility and control over material availability, even without physical movement

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication...
entry.content:
Hi Andre,
First of all, my apologies for the delay in responding. Several things came up and I completely missed replying.


As previously mentioned and as you pointed out, we reviewed the transaction and the records, which—curiously—were correct at the time of the review. That is, it was the Datasphere monitor that was showing a duplication, but the records in the tables and transactions were actually correct.


The strange part is that the next day everything went back to normal, and the records were displayed correctly. Since we didn’t know what to make of it, we raised a ticket directly with SAP to understand what happened—why the monitor showed a duplication—and to find out how we can prevent it from happening again in the future.


Thank you very much for your time and response. I hope to update you soon on what actually happened and what SAP tells us so we can avoid this particular issue moving forward.

Wishing you an excellent week.

Best regards,
EBZ.

entry.title: SAP BTP - An Executive Introduction
entry.content:
@timoelliott is an innovation evangelist with SAP.  In this executive overview of SAP Business Technology Platform, Timo introduces the value of SAP BTP, its solutions, differentiators, key customer references and where to learn more. You can watch the original video here .

You may have noticed there's a lot of chaos in the modern world. Change seems to be changing faster, from pandemics that turn the world upside down to big, unexpected tariff changes that disrupt the world's supply chains overnight. And since everything relies on technology these days, reacting quickly to market changes means changing your computer systems. And that's not always as easy as it should be.

I'm sure you've seen this quote before: "Since the dawn of time, the key to survival has always been the ability to change." And yet, more than 80% of companies responding to a recent survey from McKinsey said they did not feel well-prepared to deal with rising volatility.

What are organizations looking to achieve? Well, in order to deal with faster change, we need to transform transformation — accelerate our ability to innovate. In conversations with you, our customers, we find three key themes. First, companies are looking to better connect and coordinate their teams across internal silos so the company can act as one. Second, they're looking to take advantage of AI and automation to be able to adjust back-end systems faster than is possible when everything is done manually. Third, everyone wants to explore new business models: selling connected services rather than just products, or moving to subscription pricing, or developing more customized services, and so on.

So while it's difficult to create a formal ROI case for business agility, the reality is it makes the difference between surviving and thriving. The ability to change faster than the competition is one of THE biggest and most powerful differentiators you can have in your industry.

But you don't need me to tell you that change is hard. You probably have lots of disparate, disconnected systems that have grown up over the years, and they all talk different languages. Maintenance probably takes up a big chunk of your time and resources. Making changes means wading into custom code and integrations and involves a lot of costs and above all, risk. These are, after all, the systems that keep your business running. And it can be difficult finding the people with the right skills to solve today's technology challenges. And the data backs this up.

70% of CIOs say their current systems lack the agility to scale and integrate with modern technologies like AI. 80% of CIOs cite data quality and semantic challenges as their biggest obstacles to AI success. And 45% of businesses operating on legacy systems are less likely to adopt enterprise-wide AI due to technology limitations.

We all know that business transformation isn't about technology, but it certainly relies heavily on it. So the CIO has a critical role helping shepherd the competing demands from different areas of the business while maintaining a coherent technology strategy and governance. At SAP, our Business Suite vision aims to enable CIOs as transformational chief innovation officers rather than just chief infrastructure officers. Where IT is a strategic partner for the organization, and goes beyond IT management to drive transformation: aligning technology with the business goals.

SAP Business Technology Platform is what we use as the foundation for SAP's own innovations, and we have over 150 different applications running on the platform. But of course, we also make it available to you and our vast ecosystem of partners to help all areas of the business succeed, in partnership with the CIO. The platform is most often used by IT departments, but it's all about creating better business outcomes.

So what is SAP BTP? Well, it's a multi-cloud platform-as-a-service to unlock the full potential of your business. Optimized to work with SAP solutions, it's a unified platform of best of breed technologies to extend and integrate business applications and to infuse artificial intelligence and context-aware business data into everything you do.

We know that there are lots of different development environments out there, so when and why might SAP BTP be the right solution for your business needs? First, we've been in the business of business processes for decades. SAP BTP has out-of-the-box support to connect your processes and applications to just about any other system and application on the planet. Second, it's built for business. When you're designing something to extend your existing business applications and processes, there's no point reinventing the wheel. You can just quickly and easily leverage all the user object to security information that's already in your system. Third, we've been building AI into our applications for years, and while it's easy to do quick and powerful proof of concept projects with the latest gen AI technology, all the analyst research research shows that the vast majority of AI projects fail to go into production or add business value. We have deep expertise in helping our customers build mission-critical systems. We built robust assembly lines to integrate relevant, reliable and responsible business AI into all of our applications and we provide the same tested, production-ready tools to you. And finally, studies have proved that BTP adds value to other SAP Business Suite applications with a strong return on investment when BTP is deployed together with applications like SAP Cloud ERP, Successfactors, Ariba, and Finance.

SAP BTP is available globally with 42 data centers worldwide. It's helped over 33,000 customers achieve measurable impact across all industries and lines of business. Over 10,000 pre-built best practice artifacts speed up your time to value with pre-implemented workflows, and with a growing ecosystem of 3,200 partners that have built industry and line of business solutions on top of the platform, you're likely to find out-of-the-box solutions for your particular needs. And SAP BTP is recognized by leading analyst firms as a best in class vendor, leading in numerous technology categories.

Let's dive into the real content. SAP BTP covers five major solution areas: integration, application development and automation, artificial intelligence, data and analytics, and platform foundation. Let's look at each of these key areas in a bit more detail.

 

First, integration. Integration is one of the most time consuming and painful parts of any innovation project today. Organizations typically juggle multiple integration solutions, creating complexity, which in turn leads to longer projects and disjointed systems that continue to jeopardize business resiliency. So how does Integration Suite help with these challenges? SAP Integration Suite is a modern, scalable, and secure integration platform-as-a-service, empowering businesses to integrate all applications, systems and data across all landscapes, with one solution offering comprehensive capabilities to accelerate productivity and ensure reliable connectivity. Thousands of pre-built content allow you to deploy faster and more easily, greatly increasing your time to value. There are over 3,900 built-in integrations, over 4,000 ready-to-use integration APIs for faster connectivity, and Gartner recently rated SAP Integration Suite a market leader for the fifth consecutive year running.

Harrods, the iconic luxury department store first opened its doors in Knightsbridge, London, in 1849. To support its digital transformation and strategic shift to a modern e-commerce platform, the company selected SAP Integration Suite to connect both cloud and on-premise technologies, internal and third-party systems across multiple protocols, all within a single platform. The result was a 40% reduction in total costs and 30% shorter process times, and with the standardization, Harrods can now more easily engage with partners and expand its global presence to meet increased customer demand in new markets, including China and the Middle East.

 

The second solution area for BTP is application development and automation. Building and extending enterprise applications with the wrong tools can be difficult and expensive, and deep collaboration between the business is always required for a successful outcome. Extensions need to be securely integrated with your core business systems. This is where SAP Build comes in. It provides tools for all levels of expertise, from professional developers to power users who only want to drag and drop to create applications. Analyst studies show that SAP Build drives 3X developer productivity and you can start coding with natural language: AI now understands your business, technology, data, and context. Deep integration with SAP and non-SAP applications provides the fastest way to create an application, automated process, or business site in a clean-core way. There are already over 17,000 customers using SAP Build solutions.

For example, in order to engage with the Gen Z audience, engineering multinational ThyssenKrupp has launched a new social media recruiting channel. The core of this approach is an app built in-house using the low-code SAP Build Apps development environment, helping citizen developers create and manage workflows for different HR applications. The intuitive app empowers personnel in more than 100 different HR departments to quickly create application flows for different job types, without needing any coding skills. This helps ThyssenKrupp respond to changing recruitment requirements in an agile and efficient way.

 

The third solution area of BTP we’ll look at is artificial intelligence. We could obviously talk for hours about AI, but the key challenges are that there are not enough resources to adopt AI as quickly as everybody would like across the enterprise, that the business data required for scaling AI is typically very fragmented, and that large language models are not always accurate and trustworthy. The AI in BTP is designed for trust. We have built a production-ready AI orchestration platform to allow you to embed AI into all of your business processes with confidence. We use that platform to provide over 230 individual use cases across the SAP Business Suite, and we're training specific AI models on high-quality, industry-specific tabular business data, and leveraging our deep process knowledge. In addition, AI is built into all of the BTP solutions such as Joule studio and Build for developers.

 

For example, when Germany was hit by a sharp rise in energy prices recently because of getting cut off from Russian gas, the City of Hamburg used SAP AI services and other solutions to efficiently process almost 100,000 applications relating to aid. The financial aid platform was launched in only two weeks, and allowed the city of Hamburg to start distributing €2.5 billion in special fund to public and private cultural institutions. It's an intuitive, self-service platform that leverages generative AI to support a digitalized application process for cultural events, including the initial request, the validity checks, objection handling and payment. BTP and AI greatly sped up the processing of the applications far quicker than would otherwise been possible.

 

The fourth solution area of BTP is data and analytics provided by Business Data Cloud. Business users need data for all of their analytics planning needs in real time, with full business context. At SAP, we believe this requires integration between all data platforms and business applications with data products based on a one-domain model for consistency—and connecting insights and business decisions is now more important than ever in the new AI era. SAP Business Data Cloud accelerates the process of turning data into decisions with “insights-as-a-service”: pre-built, out-of-the-box analytic apps to help you make smart decisions faster. They leverage fully-managed, curated data products across all lines of business, providing advanced analytics and planning apps across core enterprise, analytics, finance, people, and much more. It unifies and governs all SAP data and seamlessly connects with third party data using Delta Sharing and Data Federation to connect all your data with zero copies. And you can easily create AI apps and AI models trained on your business data, using for example, SAP Databricks. That semantically-rich data helps ground your AI to ensure accurate outcomes with Joule Copilot to accelerate productivity and automate complex business processes. Data and AI governance is more important than ever. With SAP Business Data Cloud, business users get clean ownership with minimal engineering overhead.

Leading global airline group Lufthansa sought to harmonize critical data from siloed systems across its subsidiaries by integrating the SAP Datasphere solution, now part of Business Data Cloud, with a partner solution on SAP Business Technology platform. It federated SAP and third-party data while preserving key metadata, making it available for analytics and business intelligence. They took data from over 20 different cloud and on-premise systems scattered across various subsidiaries, and brought it all together for a consolidated 360 degree view of the organization's financial performance, with greater spend transparency across various source systems, helping deliver better margins and resilience.

 

The fifth and final key solution area of BTP is the platform foundation. With threat vectors from many sources, companies are prioritizing security at the highest levels. At the same time, IT leaders need to streamline operations while providing the application scalability needed for the business to stay competitive. SAP BTP Platform Foundation provides the secure, scalable and reliable foundation you need to innovate with confidence across your business suite. It provides all the critical functionality to deliver production-ready innovation environments. It provides efficient application lifecycle management; streamlined development with integrated access controls to ensure global identity security and compliance; a global platform abstraction layer for integration across all core hyperscalers provides flexibility for the future; secure connectivity is provided for all applications and data across hybrid environments; and there are automated management and performance tools to streamline administration and operations.

Mahindra Group has been an SAP customer for 25 years, enabling the conglomerate to grow and continuously innovate. And now they're leaping into a cloud-based digital future. With the RISE with SAP solution and SAP Business Technology Platform was a logical next step for the company. The BTP foundation capabilities allowed them to accelerate the development of their new mission-critical workloads, optimize IT costs with a scalable and on-demand cloud infrastructure, and meet sustainability goals by reducing carbon emissions from IT systems. They automated over 250 processes and gave business users more self-service functionality, saving over 1,000 workdays, giving them more time to work on more strategic tasks. And they were even able to decommission 194 different servers, leading to a much lower IT carbon footprint.

In summary, we've looked at the five key areas of BTP: integration, application development and automation artificial intelligence, data and analytics, and platform foundation. SAP BTP empowers you to integrate and extend business applications faster; connects systems and processes across the enterprise; and personalize applications for your business needs. Create business relevant apps with all your data: leverage SAP Business Data Cloud to build smarter applications and develop reliable AI solutions grounded in full business context. Innovate and accelerate with artificial intelligence: boost developer productivity with generative AI, securely infuse AI models into applications, and develop reliable AI solutions at scale.

 

To close, I'd like to highlight a recent study from IDC that summarizes the value of BTP for SAP customers. Customers in the study, on average, found a three-year return on investment of over 500% and eight months to pay back their investment, with significantly higher productivity for their development teams.

To find out more, please visit sap.com/btp to learn everything you need about SAP’s technology platform for all applications. You can get started for free—try before you buy to test drive the power of SAP BTP. And please join our growing community of SAP technology users to meet others facing the same business challenges and opportunities that you are, and get your SAP BTP questions asked and answered. I wish you the very best of luck with your projects. Thank you very much for your time and goodbye!

entry.title: Re: How to add fields to LSMW Standard Batch Input
entry.content:
Hi @ABS21 

Thanks for your question.

Since you're using LSMW with standard batch input (Object 0480 / Method 0000) for Functional Location Task Lists (IA11) and the two new fields appear in the IA11 UI but not in the IBIPTLOP structure, it indicates that these fields are not supported by the standard batch input program (RCPTRA01).

This is my suggestion on how to Proceed:
Create a custom LSMW recording for transaction IA01/IA11, which captures screen fields including those not supported by batch input structures. However, this can be brittle if screens vary by user or SAP version.

Unfortunately, for IA11 there is no standard BAPI for uploading Functional Location Task Lists. So this might not be feasible unless you build a custom program.


If the fields are part of custom enhancements (e.g. appended to CI structures), you may need to use a custom BDC or enhance the batch input structure (though SAP doesn’t recommend modifying standard structures).

Alternatively, If the fields belong to custom append structures, you might consider using a custom Z-program or eCATT that directly updates the required tables.

I hope this gives more clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Onboarding - Know your key people
entry.content:
Hi @tomaszgondek 

Thank you for your question.

You're correct that in Onboarding 1.0, it was possible to customize the “Know Your Key People” section to display specific roles through configuration. However, in Onboarding 2.0, this section is more restricted and primarily auto populated with the manager’s details by default.

As of today, there is no standard configuration available in Onboarding 2.0 to force the display of additional people e.g., someone from IT alongside the manager unless they are added via recommendation or assignment.

That said, I suggest you do the following:

  • Create a custom MDF object or business rule to auto-assign recommended people during onboarding.
  • Use Process Variant Manager to guide the flow based on criteria.
  • Add a custom UI tile or card in the New Hire Dashboard via People Profile extensions (Please note, this is more of a workaround than native functionality).

If SAP releases a new feature or enhancement allowing more flexibility in this area, it would be documented in the What's New Viewer or release notes.

I hope this gives more clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Stock not transferred from ROD storage location after...
entry.content:
Hi @CharlotteH 

Thanks for your detailed explanation of the scenario.

Your observation is correct. The automatic 411 movement from ROD to AFS which normally triggers upon putaway warehouse task confirmation does not happen again after the delivery is reprocessed in SMQ2, particularly if the warehouse tasks had already been confirmed.

The reason is as follows:

The designated trigger for the 411 movement is tightly linked to the initial warehouse task confirmation event.

Once that confirmation has occurred, reprocessing the inbound queue (LUW in SMQ2) doesn’t retrigger the stock movement logic, as the system considers the physical stock movement already completed.

Here is my suggestion on how to resolve it:

  • If the stock is still technically in the ROD location but not reflected in AFS, you can manually post the 411 movement (ROD → AFS) via MB1B or MIGO using movement type 411/E (if relevant for your scenario).
  • You may also use the Adjust Stock Posting transaction /SCWM/ADGI to realign stock between EWM and MM if you have inconsistencies after queue reprocessing.
  • If this happens frequently, consider implementing a BAdI or enhancement to monitor the state of warehouse tasks and trigger the required movement or follow-up delivery update logic post-SMQ2 reprocessing.

 

Please note, there may be a relevant SAP Note or fix depending on your release version. If this behaviour is not consistent with expected design, I’d suggest raising an incident under component SCM-EWM-IF-ERP to confirm with SAP if it can be handled more gracefully in newer releases or via a standard BADI.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Recording Additional Costs on a Purchase Order in SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @MariaIsabelPaz 

Thanks for sharing your requirement.

Yes, you can indeed post a second supplier invoice (Supplier B) for additional costs like freight or customs and associate it with the same purchase order (even if Supplier A has already invoiced the goods).

This is how you can achieve that:

Use the Fiori app to post the additional invoice. You can reference the same PO and assign the costs as separate invoice line items tied to service or unplanned items.


If your PO includes a condition item for freight or other costs, you can add related invoice amounts against those PO items (ensuring they don’t affect stock quantity). Otherwise, you can still enter costs as separate line items manually.

If you’re managing landed costs across multiple suppliers, SAP supports planned delivery costs in public cloud, where Supplier B invoices (e.g. customs) are recorded and posted to separate liability or cost accounts.

If you use Transportation Management (TM), you can post unplanned freight charges in the invoice and refer to a freight order or freight booking. These can be invoiced separately and tied back to the source PO.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

 

See useful links below:

Create Purchase Order Centrally

Create Supplier Invoices - Advanced

Invoicing Freight Orders

entry.title: Re: remove comma from the last line on output file in the...
entry.content:
Hi @user116 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP SuccessFactors Integration Center, when generating an EDI/Stacked Delimited file, there isn’t a direct UI option to suppress the trailing comma on the last line.

However, here is my suggestion:

  • Create a calculated field that appends a delimiter (comma) only if it is not the last record. This typically requires adding a flag using Integration Centre’s sequencing or row numbering logic, which can be complex for stacked formats.
  • If you’re exporting the file to an SFTP or middleware, consider adding a post-processing script that removes the trailing comma from the last line before sending it downstream.
  • Since the current Integration Center has limited formatting controls for EDI/stacked files, you may also consider submitting an enhancement request via the SAP Influence Portal.

Unfortunately, there is currently no built-in toggle in Integration Center to remove the last comma for stacked EDI output.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Automatic and Manual Payment Errors in SAP S/4HANA Cl...
entry.content:
Hello @MariaIsabelPaz 

Thank you for your message.

Even though IBAN isn’t mandatory in Venezuela, the system still validates vendor bank data based on the assigned payment method. If required fields like bank key, account number, or account holder are missing or misaligned with the configuration for payment method T, the automatic payment run may fail.

Since you already followed KBA 3444334, I’d recommend double-checking:

  • That all mandatory bank fields are filled for the vendor.
  • That payment method T is properly configured for Venezuela.
  • That the bank account is correctly maintained in the Business Partner app.

If everything looks correct, the issue might stem from backend validation still expecting certain fields like IBAN. In that case, opening an SAP support ticket with your system details may help clarify the validation logic.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: User Type FW is Not Active in SAP?
entry.content:
User Type FW is Not Active Error 

When we try to create a reference user or copy an existing user using SU01 t-code in SAP then we face the error message: User Type FW is not active in SAP. 

This error comes when the user you are copying is of type FW (Workflow System User), and in your system, this user type is not yet activated or supported because the workflow configuration is incomplete. 

In my case, we faced this issue specifically with user type FW but in your case the user type may be different. So it’s important to first identify your user type. 

How to Check and Activate Missing User Types using USMM T-Code.

  1. First Run the T-code USMM in the SAP GUI. 
  2. Then Click on the User Types tab. 

 

       3. Select and activate the missing user type FW or any other that's required. 

       4. Save your changes. 

Now try to create or copy the reference user again. If the error persists feel free to reach out or comment below if I can help resolve your issue I definitely will!

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori transaction access log report–how to track...
entry.content: And how do you measure today that a transaction was used in SAP Logon? Regardless how you do it... it should still work. Launchpad content manager is not a "conversion" tool. No Fiori app/artifact is generated based from this tcode. It is as simple as having the tcode available in Fiori just like it could be used in webgui. Any access to a given tcode, regardless if it is from SAP Logon, webgui or Fiori is just the same because it is the same ABAP application being called under the hood.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Edit or Delete Line in SSCUI 101045 – Bank...
entry.content:
Hello @BlasRosello4 

The issue you're facing in SSCUI 101045 is due to an incomplete line, causing the system to trigger the error:
Specify both accounts or none at all.

As per SAP KBA 3552078, SAP Support cannot delete or adjust SSCUI entries in S/4 Public Edition. Corrections must be made directly in the SSCUI.

Recommended options:

  • Complete both account fields (Account ID and Subaccount), then try to delete the line.
  • If not possible, create a new configuration with a different house bank or payment method to bypass the faulty entry.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Extract data from S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using...
entry.content:
Hello @Magesh07 

Direct access via IDoc, BAPI, or database tables is not supported in S4HANA Public cloud. Therefore, SAP Data Services (BODS) cannot extract data through Cloud Connector or RFC.

However, extraction is supported via:

  • Standard OData APIs (available on SAP API Hub)
  • Custom CDS Views exposed as OData services
  • BODS REST/OData datastore to consume these APIs
  • For data load, the only supported method is the Migrate Your Data app (Migration Cockpit).

Refer to the documentations below

Migrate Your Data - Migration Cockpit 

Business Accelerator Hub -SAP 

2590508 - Import or Export Data from/to SAP S/4HANA to/from SAP Analytics Cloud 

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Leveraging SAP S/4HANA for Tank Planning and -Scheduling
entry.content:
The setup / configuration for tank planning is documented under SAP.HELP.COM
Basically it involves the following master data:
- Container Resource (Resource with Storage Characteristics)
- Product Data Structures (PDS)
- Product Storage Definition (PSD)

Orders (planned / process / production / procurement / stock transfer orders) on tank / container resources change the projected fill level with their respective fill / draining activities.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori transaction access log report–how to track...
entry.content:
Why is this a new answer? Anyway...

The 'how' depends on those questions and your requirement. My questions are not necessarily done to help you but to help others (including myself) helping you.

More information = higher chances someone can help you
Clear information = higher chances of someone help you 

See how good is asking questions

  • Your initial question gives the impression that you had tcodes were recreated as 'real' (aka SAPUI5 apps). After the questions and after your clarifications now it's clear that this is not the case.
  • Your initial question was not clear where your Fiori launchpad was (as there are tags for both Business Suite + S/4HANA) -> now it's clear
  • Your initial question gives the impression that you have already one way of tracking user access for transaction codes (for example by using some tcode such as ST03N). If that was the case, then any activity in Fiori would be part of this report as well -> of course, not with all information such as device. My point was to understand that the tcodes inside Fiori are NOT other apps. They are THE SAME app callable in SAP Logon. -> now it's clear do don't track anything today regardless if it's from FLP or not
  • Your initial question says that you want to create reports based on logs. Despite this being achievable in some extend as logs are plenty in SAP and rather well structure, some of them are kept for just a few hours, days, weeks or months in the system. It's likely that you won't be able to create decent reports by extracting data from just a few days.

I could go even deeper but I guess that is not the point. For instance, your question implies you want to track user-specific activity. This is not even GDPR compliant depending on the way you do it (and there are many way of making it uncompliant). So how will someone suggest something here without even knowing what is your goal? I am assuming that this was a concern already addressed during the initial phase of your project as you are already in the middle of it 😉 So this one you don't need to answer.

Nevertheless, here is just a small brainstorming some options but please understand how challenging this might be.

1) Use google analytics

Good news:

  • you can get this and way more data for free
  • you don't need to rely on logs on logs retention
  • you can create reports directly from it or connect it with Looker Studio (former Google Data Studio)
  • probably the best way of measuring device information

Bad news: 

  • GA tracks page access and Fiori itself in a Single Page application so using GA alone will not be able to identify when someone opens a new app...
    • Good news: unless you use Google Tag Manager with some configuration to detect fragment changes
  • You must change the standard SAP code to add GA tag inside the launchpad .html file 
  • You will need to review that change on each and every upgrade or SAP_UI component upgrade
  • You will need to be creative how to show the app names in the reports you will basically have the browser hash of an app
  • It requires more non-fiori knowledge than fiori knowledge

2) Develop a FLP plugin

Good news:

  • You can develop a plugin that is loaded during FLP startup and that tracks hash changes. This plugin should also detect when an app is called in a new tab.
  • Gives you more flexibility that GA

Bad news:

  • Your plugin would need to consume an custom API created for you to store data
  • Not all apps might be called inside the launchpad
  • It will require some good investigation how the launchpad works

3) Search for existing enhancements points

Good news:

  • One that might be helpful is /UI2/ES_NAVIGATION as it contains code that is called in certain moments during app navigation

Bad news:

  • If it is good enough still you will need to implement your own logic in there

Good news: all 3 would be near impossible if you'd be using work zone in BTP.

I was successful in the past using option 1. The setup is not big but without some good GA + Google Tag Manager knowledge might be challenging. 

I've seen many other tracking tools that are not an option based on your description (such as collecting SAP Gateway logs and consolidating them). It should be possible to find some implementations of 1 and 2 here and there.

PS: we are all in the middle of projects. The difference is that some of them invest some time helping others here and some others not 🙂

entry.title: Re: Handling inventory updates from EWM to S/4HANA Cloud...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

In the 7L1 integration between decentral EWM and S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, warehouse-driven updates (like pick denial and inventory differences) are not supported in the standard.

SAP does not provide a standard way to sync these updates back to ERP. The only workaround is to build custom integrations using.

  • Events from EWM
  • SAP Cloud Integration (CPI)

Public APIs in S/4HANA Cloud (API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV, API_MATERIALDOCUMENT_SRV)

This is a customer-owned solution, SAP does not officially support or maintain it. So yes, CPI is commonly used, but it’s not SAP’s recommended or delivered fix.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?
entry.content:
Question

Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?

The invoice and accounting require the amounts of each interest rate to be displayed separately.

 

Analysis 

 At the customer XXXXX, it is required that the FINT transaction calculates and settles the interest and the surcharge separately. At this moment, in the test, the settlement of interest and the surcharge is totaled for the calculation, and thus it is carried to the generated accounting document.  

The client requires that the amount of interest (in this case 18%) be shown separately from the surcharge (in this case 2%) in the accounting records.

entry.title: HCM Brasil - Configuração de Naturezas Informativas de Rubricas do eSocial
entry.content:
Olá pessoal,

Estamos animados em compartilhar uma atualização importante que otimizar a gestão de eventos de rubricas informativas do eSocial para sua empresa. Com a nova funcionalidade "Naturezas Informativas de Rubricas do eSocial", você agora tem a flexibilidade de definir quais naturezas irão gerar eventos informativos S-1010.

O que é essa funcionalidade?

A funcionalidade permite que nossos clientes definam quais naturezas geram eventos informativos S-1010. Isso é feito através da personalização da visão Naturezas informativas de rubricas do eSocial (V_T7BREFD_NATINF). Com essa capacidade, as empresas podem ter um controle mais preciso sobre quais rubricas são reportadas como informativas ao eScoial.

Caso a solução existente atenda às necessidades de sua empresa, você não precisa customizar a visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF, o sistema irá gerar os eventos informativos S-1010 da maneira que sempre fez. O sistema considera todas as naturezas que começam com '99' ou os códigos específicos '4051', '6101', '1806', '1808' e '1810'. 

Configuração da visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF

Se a solução existente não atender às necessidades de sua empresa, você pode configurar a visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF informando TODAS naturezas classificadas como informativas. Certifique-se de configurar todas as naturezas utilizadas estaticamente pelo sistema, são elas: naturezas que começam com '99' ou os códigos específicos '4051', '6101', '1806', '1808' e '1810'.

Exemplo de configuração

Veja abaixo um exemplo de configuração da visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF, contemplando todas naturezas utilizadas estaticamente pelo sistema:

SAP Notes liberadas

Nesta entrega, as seguintes SAP notes foram liberadas:

  • 3559482 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3597076
  • 3597076 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3559875
  • 3559875 - eSocial - S-1010 - Customization option to generate Informative events

Compartilhe sua opinião!

Estamos ansiosos para ouvir suas experiências com essa nova funcionalidade. Se tiver dúvidas, sugestões ou comentários, sinta-se à vontade para compartilhar na seção de comentários abaixo.

Não se esqueça de dar um Like neste post se você achou útil e compartilhá-lo com seus colegas. Siga a tag  HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para se manter atualizado sobre as últimas notícias.

Acesse também nosso workzone exclusivo dedicado para informações sobre o eSocial e outras atualizações importantes.

Atenciosamente,

Guilherme Zenzen

entry.title: Re: SUM of sum formula - Crystal Report
entry.content:
Hello @YL1008 

You're trying to filter records based on the month from SHIPPER.SHIPPED_DATE, using a parameter like “January” or “February”. The formula field {@monthof} shows the month, but when you try to filter with:

{@monthof} = {?month of}

You get an error, totally expected. Crystal doesn’t always handle formula fields properly inside the Select Expert, especially when parameters are involved.
Here’s the reliable fix:

Create a string parameter
Call it ?month of, with static values from January to December.

Go to Report > Selection Formulas > Record and paste this:

Month({SHIPPER.SHIPPED_DATE}) =
Switch(
{?month of} = "January", 1,
{?month of} = "February", 2,
{?month of} = "March", 3,
{?month of} = "April", 4,
{?month of} = "May", 5,
{?month of} = "June", 6,
{?month of} = "July", 7,
{?month of} = "August", 8,
{?month of} = "September", 9,
{?month of} = "October", 10,
{?month of} = "November", 11,
{?month of} = "December", 12
)

That tells Crystal to match the numeric month from the shipped date against the name selected in your parameter. It’s much cleaner and avoids the formula field issue altogether.

Let me know if you want to also filter by year or need help showing the selected month on the report.

You can place ?month of on the report header to show which month is being filtered.
Important Notes

Do not use totext(month(...)) for filtering — it's fine for display only.

Do not use formula fields inside Select Expert if they depend on parameters — they may not resolve at runtime.

Let me know if you'd also like to filter by year, or want the formula to return a date range instead (e.g. from 01.MM.YYYY to 31.MM.YYYY).

StackOverflow examples where similar logic is applied: Filter Crystal Report by month string parameter 

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to separate the calculation of interes...
entry.content:
Hello @LeonardoMantilla 

It is not possible to separate interest and surcharge amounts in the standard interest calculation process in S4 Public cloud. The system calculates and posts a single combined amount to one G/L account.

Since enhancements like user exits are not available in Public Cloud, the logic cannot be modified. If separation is required, consider,

  • Manual reclassification after posting
  • Custom reporting logic to simulate the split

For long-term needs, you may submit a request via the SAP Customer Influence Portal.

Configuration for Interest Calculation-SAP help

Item Interest Calculation-SAP help 

With kind regards

Chuma
